Joins Bonnie in playful singing and serenading, engaging in lighthearted behavior rather than focusing on serious matters.
Plays along with Bonnie in a playful counting game before sleep.
Does not respond to the police officers knocking, instead fires at them and escapes.
Firing steadily at police to hold them off during a raid, then running into the garage to get the car for escape.
Playing along with Bonnie in a lighthearted countdown despite the danger, showing confidence and calm.
Runs to the garage door, flings it up to enable escape under fire.
Shoots while driving the car to protect his group during the escape.
Fires automatic weapon while running to garage door, quickly opens it, and gets into the car under heavy gunfire.
Drives the car with one hand while shooting with the other during an intense gun battle.
Dashes out of the car and drags Buck into the back seat to protect him despite ongoing gunfire.
Keeps driving the car at high speed while others are hysterical and in pain, remaining silent and focused.
Dashes out of the car and drags BUCK into the back seat under heavy gunfire.
Keeps the car on the road while swerving madly at high speed, escaping police pursuit.
Remains silent and focused, driving at 90 mph despite chaos and suffering inside the car.
Stops the car to take a new vehicle for the gang's use, showing practical concern for the group.
Lays Buck down and attempts to administer to his wounds, wiping him off despite limited medical ability.
Leads the gang into a secluded field to regroup and care for the injured, showing protective behavior.
Stops the car, identifies a valuable target quickly, and orchestrates a quiet car theft and escape.
Attempts to administer first aid to Buck despite limited medical knowledge, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Leads the gang into a remote field to regroup and tend to the wounded, demonstrating strategic thinking to avoid detection.
Despite the dire situation, maintains some control and direction over the group.
Kneels beside his wounded brother Buck, takes his hand, smooths his hair back, and cries quietly.
Looks dumbly down at his mangled brother, unable to respond verbally to Blanche's pleas.
Kneels beside his wounded brother, holds his hand, and gently smooths his hair back, showing care and emotional presence despite the dire situation.
Looks dumbly down at his mangled brother and does not respond to urgent requests to get to a doctor, indicating paralysis or inability to act decisively in a crisis.
Cries a little and gently smooths back Buck's hair with ritualistic regularity.
Responds immediately to a surprise surrender call by grabbing his gun and firing several shots.
Fails to recognize the overwhelming number of enemies surrounding them, leading to being ambushed by at least 150 armed men.
Does not fire back at attackers while escaping, prioritizing survival over retaliation.
Focuses on getting the gang to safety despite being wounded, showing concern for others.
Attempts to escape under heavy fire by driving the car through a dangerous, heavily ambushed area.
Does not fire back at attackers during the escape attempt, focusing solely on driving.
Loses control of the car after being shot in the arm, resulting in a crash.
Scrambles toward the edge of the woods with Bonnie and C.W. under heavy fire, attempting to escape.
Returns to help Bonnie after she is shot, drags her out of the water, and carries her toward safety despite his own exhaustion.
Returns to rescue wounded Bonnie under fire, drags her to safety, and attempts to find a car despite injury and danger.
Sweeps Bonnie into a close embrace immediately upon arriving, holding onto her tightly and not moving.
Falls in and out of consciousness with a bleeding arm but still remains close to Bonnie and C.W., showing concern despite his own pain.
Tumbles out of the car quickly and supports Bonnie, showing presence of mind and care under pressure.
Sustains an arm injury and falls in and out of consciousness while escaping, indicating vulnerability and physical limitation.
Gives a clear, direct instruction to C.W. to 'Head out,' showing decisiveness despite injury.
Nods his head in a barely perceptible gesture by way of saying 'thank you' to the people who helped him.
Feigns exhaustion and uses the alias 'Moss' to gain trust and obtain water and food from suspicious strangers.
Remains semi-conscious and unable to actively engage or defend himself, relying on others' goodwill.
Nods his head in a barely perceptive gesture by way of saying 'thank you' to the people.
Calls his father for help and asks to get his injured friends inside.
Calmly signals to his father for help despite being injured and in trouble, showing presence of mind and ability to seek assistance.
Appears confused initially about the tattoo on his chest, indicating some lack of awareness or distraction.
Expresses anger and indignation over accusations that he fled and left his brother to die, showing loyalty and protective feelings toward family.
Strides the porch angrily, snapping the rope, and challenges the newspaper's claim that he fled, showing indignation and a desire to set the record straight.
Moves upon Malcolm with enormous intent to justify his actions, indicating a forceful and confident communication style.
Reassures Bonnie with kindness and acknowledges her support.
Encourages C.W. by telling him to be thankful for his anonymity and safety.
Shows anger and frustration over their situation but maintains control around Bonnie.
Plans to take the bank once recovered, showing determination and forward thinking.
Acknowledges his dizziness and physical weakness but maintains control and focus.
Expresses frustration over being wrongly accused but does not lose composure.
Uses humor and reassurance to lift spirits of companions, showing social intelligence.
Offers to pay Malcolm forty dollars for hospitality despite Malcolm's refusal.
Maintains a good mood and is expansive in conversation with Malcolm.
Offers to pay Malcolm forty dollars for hospitality despite Malcolm's refusal, showing social awareness and confidence in handling the situation.
Maintains a good mood and expansive demeanor when interacting with Malcolm, indicating emotional control and interpersonal skill.
Offers Bonnie a ginger-snap while they sit together in the car.
More interested in reading the newspaper than engaging with Bonnie's contentment and warmth.
Eats ginger-snaps while reading a newspaper, showing calmness and ability to maintain composure despite injuries and stressful circumstances.
Offers a ginger-snap to Bonnie in a small, considerate gesture, indicating attentiveness and social awareness.
Appears distracted and less engaged in conversation, responding with 'Uh-huh...' while more focused on the paper, which could suggest detachment or lack of emotional engagement.
Shows mild interest in Bonnie's poem and encourages her to share it, appealing to his ego but engaging with her creative effort.
More interested in his paper than Bonnie's company, showing detachment when she expresses contentment.
Shows mild interest in the photo and comments on Bonnie's changed appearance.
Encourages Bonnie to share her poem and suggests mailing it to the law for publicity, appealing to his ego.
Laughs heartily and expresses delight at being immortalized in the poem, shares the moment joyfully with Bonnie.
Wipes away Bonnie's tears and hugs her tightly, showing affection and tenderness.
Expresses gleeful wonder and delight upon seeing himself immortalized in a poem, showing confidence and self-recognition as a legendary figure.
Focuses on his celebrity and legend status rather than practical concerns or plans.
Looks at Bonnie with love and delight, hugs her tightly, shares laughter and intimacy with her.
Seeks Bonnie's approval and openly expresses his anxiety about his performance.
Lovingly pulls Bonnie into him and kisses her, showing affection and openness.
Seeks Bonnie's approval and reassurance after an important personal experience, showing self-awareness and desire to do well.
Expresses anxiety and uncertainty about his performance, indicating some lack of confidence despite eventual relief.
Licks ice cream quietly, shows calmness and detachment in a tense family moment.
Implied by Malcolm's fear and warning to his son not to get in the car with Clyde, indicating a threatening or intimidating presence.
Responds confidently and casually to Malcolm's question about going downtown with Bonnie and Clyde, indicating familiarity and ease with the situation.

Shows obtuseness or lack of awareness when Malcolm warns him not to get back in the car with Bonnie and Clyde, asking why and what to say, indicating a lack of understanding of the danger or implications.
Suddenly proposes marriage to Bonnie, showing vulnerability and desire for connection.
Boasts confidently that nobody can catch him, showing arrogance and dismissiveness.
Confidently asserts that nobody catches him, showing belief in his own abilities and instincts.
Proposes marriage to Bonnie despite the obvious legal and practical obstacles, indicating a lack of practical foresight.
Attempts to comfort Bonnie when she cries, awkwardly holds her and puts his arm around her.
Responds to Bonnie's emotional vulnerability with a humorous but sincere answer about marriage.
Thinks about a better future and expresses a desire to live clean and start over.
Attempts to comfort Bonnie awkwardly but sincerely when she is emotional, showing some social awareness and care.
Thinks about how he would change his criminal strategy to be more effective, suggesting strategic thinking and learning from experience.
Uses humor to deflect a serious question about marriage, indicating some social skill but possibly avoiding deeper reflection.
Looks down at Bonnie anxiously after realizing he said the wrong thing.
Engages in lighthearted banter with Bonnie about driving with shoes off and wearing broken sunglasses.
Expresses a strategic insight about living in one state and robbing banks in another to avoid detection.
Realizes he has said the wrong thing to Bonnie and becomes anxious, showing awareness of social cues.
Sits down and removes his shoes because his feet are sweating, showing practical self-awareness.
Wears sunglasses with one lens missing and jokes about driving with one eye shut.
Affectionately responds to Bonnie's admiration of the photo, calls it 'a pretty thing, honey.'
Encourages Bonnie to share the peach by offering it to him.
Shows impatience and anxiety about the boy's delay, urging Bonnie to check on him despite her reluctance.
Takes charge decisively when the boy is missing, immediately deciding to leave and take action.
Suggests a plan to drive all night to reach the golf course by morning, showing initiative and forward thinking.
Becomes anxious and impatient waiting for the boy, then quickly takes decisive action when the boy doesn't show up.
Relies on Bonnie to check on the boy despite his growing worry, showing some delegation but also possible hesitation.
Stops the car to talk to an old man on the road, showing willingness to engage with a stranger.
Engages in a violent gunfight with law enforcement, showing readiness for deadly confrontation.
Takes careful dead aim with his gun during a sudden, intense gunfight, showing focus and skill under pressure.
Stops the car and gets out to talk to an old man on the road despite the tense situation, potentially exposing himself to danger.
